personalInfo.splInterest: Hunting, going to the shooting range, soccer

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-49 at 2014 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (subject to second reshuffle)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished the Web.com Tour season playing all 25 tournaments. Had a win and a runner-up among his six top-25s and 11 cuts made. Was 31st in the final priority-ranking order...Recorded top-15 finishes in his first four starts...Opened the fourth event, the Brasil Champions, with consecutive 66s to trail the leader by four. Made up ground with a bogey-free 65 Saturday that cut the deficit to one. Struggled in the final round, carding a 69 for a T2...Earned his first career victory with a playoff win over Bronson Burgoon at the Nova Scotia Open in early July. A 7-under 64 in Saturday's third round was highlighted by a 60-foot birdie putt at the finishing hole. Ended the round in a Tour-record six-way tie and was paired on Sunday with Burgoon, who fired a 63 in the third round. Both were tied at 12 under as they stood on the 17th tee and finished par-birdie, eliminating three contenders who were already in the clubhouse at 12 under. He was dead center with his 30-foot birdie putt on the 72nd hole and then watched as Burgoon matched it with a 12-footer of his own. In the playoff, Burgoon missed a 30-foot birdie putt from the fringe on the first playoff hole but sealed the title when he rolled in a 15-footer on the second extra hole. The 24-year-old picked up a check for $117,000 and moved from No. 39 to No. 4 on the money list after 14 of 21 Regular Season events. A dual citizen (U.S. and Mexico), he became the fourth international winner of the year and joined countryman Keoke Cotner, Esteban Toledo, Alex Aragon and Carlos Ortiz as Tour winners from Mexico...Posted just one top-25 in the seven remaining Regular Season events. Was No. 11 on the money list, at Regular Season's end, which secured his PGA TOUR card for 2015-16...A disappointing Finals' run saw him miss the cut in all four events.
tourBios.carHigh: 2014: Finished T35 at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December...Made four Web.com Tour starts and missed the cut in all four...In three PGA TOUR Canada events, made two cuts. His best showing was a T19 at the Staal Foundation Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: As a freshman at Odessa Junior College, was a Ping All-American and Jack Nicklaus Award and Phil Mickelson Award winner. Won five tournaments while there...At Oklahoma, was an Honorable Mention All-American selection and a three-time all-region choice, winning two individual tournaments and finishing second in school history to Anthony Kim in career scoring average in relation to par...Set school record for lowest 54-hole score (21-under)...Was also a two-time All-American Scholar.
tourBios.personal: Was born in South Texas but grew up in Reynosa, Mexico, where he lived until age 14. Parents are both natives of Mexico and he has dual citizenship in Mexico and the United States...Attended Sharyland High School in Mission, Texas, where he was All-Valley four years and a three-time MVP...Attended Odessa Junior College before going to and graduating from the University of Oklahoma...Got hooked on golf as the first sport he played...Early golf memories include beating his dad for the first time and meeting Jack Nicklaus...If not a professional golfer, he would pursue race-car driving...Favorite courses played include Peachtree, Torrey Pines, Whisper Rock and the Atlanta Athletic Club...Would like to play Pebble Beach, Augusta National and Pine Valley...Favorite teams as a kid were the Denver Broncos, New York Yankees and Real Madrid, they still are...Favorite TV shows include "Breaking Bad," "Dexter" and "Sons of Anarchy."...Favorite movies include "Bad Boys 2," "Gladiator" and "The Dark Knight Rises."...Favorite books are The Secret and American Sniper...Favorite foods include Mexican and Italian. Top restaurants are Ruth's Chris and BJ's...Favorite cities are Cancun and Madrid...Favorite athletes are Rafael Nadal, Cristiano Ronaldo and Peyton Manning...Favorite webites are youtube.com, facebook.com and cnn.com, and his favorite apps are SportsCenter, Vine, Netflix and Instagram...Would like to change places with Sebastian Vettel for a day because "to drive an F1 car is way too much fun."...Enjoys collecting putters...Bucket list includes jumping out of an airplane and flying a fighter jet...Favorite quote is from Zig Ziglar, who said, "You are the only person on earth who can use your ability."...His entrance song to the first tee would be "Bring 'Em Out" by T.I...Twitter account is @abraham_ancer.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T42nd in 2016 at the Valero Texas Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T38th in Approach 75-100 yards (RTP Sco on the PGA TOUR.
